div.p:
Letter notfound. The text given here is from a reportof the meeting of the Port Fairy Borough Council on 25 July 1894, Port Fairy gazette, 27 July 1894, p. 3. The Council minutes merely record the receipt of a letter from M ‘re proposed visit to Port Fairy’(Minute book 11, 06 Jun uary
1894 - 18 May 1898, p. 17, VPRS 11097/P0001, Port Fairy Borough Council records, VA 2488, Public Record Office, Victoria) .
[From Baron Von Mueller, acknowledging receipt of council's invitation to visit Port Fairy to witness the splendid results obtained by the planting of the marum grass, for which he felt highly gratified.
At a meeting of the Council on 30 June 1894,the Mayor, W. Earle, reported 'that the planting of the Marram grass had this year been carried out in a most satisfactory manner and he now thought it would be a fitting time to invite Baron Von Mueller to visit Port Fairy and see for himself the immense amount of good accruing from the introduction of Marrum grass. They were greatly indebted to the Baron and he accordingly moved "That an invitation be sent to Baron von Mueller K.C.M.G. to visit Port Fairy and see for himself the wonderful growth of the grass" — | Seconded by Cr Tennyson Carried unanimously' (minute book 11, p. 8,Port FairyBorough Council records).
He could not, however, visit the town during the winter months, as he was not in very good health, but he would come down in the summer, when the weather would be more suitable for him to move about.]
